page.title: 08Dumb Post Inn,Bremhill.
page.content: This popular inn was once part of the Bowood Estate of the Earl of Shelburne. It is believed the inn got it's name from the custom of mailmen on carrier waggons pinning letters on a post out side the inn for the local people,in the days before the Royal Mail. This georgian inn has 200 year old documents,a copy of the rules of the Dumb Post Friendly Society 1770.This was a sick benefit or thrift club. These old documents describe the Club Walk in Whit Week, a trek from the inn to the village cross,a service in St.Martin's Church,and a village day of feasting and celebration. The Dumb Post is a very popular inn for summer visitors and many ask to see the old documents.
